1 - Windows
1.1 - Installation
On Windows systems, double-click the file SCS Installer.exe.
A welcome screen will appear. Click the Next button.
Choose the directory where the SCS will be installed. Click on the Browse button or enter the directory path then click the Next button.
Click on the Install button when you are ready to proceed with the installation.
When installation completes, the installer will start the SCS Setup application to proceed with the initial setup of the SCS.
The steps below describe the minimal configuration steps.
Refer to the SCS Setup application documentation for complete information about the SCS Setup application.
1.2 - HTTP setup
The SCS Setup application starts, focused on the Base configuration tab:
Enter the following information:
  • In the Hostname textbox, enter the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the machine hosting the SCS (i.e. the machine on which you just installed to SCS).
    A FQDN consists of the machine name followed by the domain suffix e.g.: mymachine.mydomain.com
  • In the HTTP port textbox, enter a TCP port number. The port must be available as the SCS will use it to listen for incoming HTTP requests.
  • In the HTTPS port textbox, enter a TCP port number. The port must be available as the SCS will use it to listen for incoming HTTPS requests.
  • In the Administration password textbox, enter a password. This password will be necessary to connect to the SCS Web Manager.
Then click the Save button.
1.3 - License installation
Click the License tab:
Click the Export Instance ID browse button to select the location where the SCS instance ID file should be saved:
Then click the Save button.
Send generated file by email to your Sword contact, requesting a license for this SCS instance ID.
You will receive a files named scs.lic in return.
Save this scs.lic file anywhere on the machine and click the Import License browse button to indicate the location where the SCS license file has been saved:
Then click the Open button.
If the license is valid, the Invalid license message will change and indicate the license expiration date.
1.4 - SSL certificate
Click the Certificates tab:
The SCS is delivered with a self-signed certificate valid for the host localhost - which is not ideal because web browsers and the GSA will not trust this certificate and you will get a security warning every time you connect to the SCS Web Manager.
First, generate a certificate for the correct FQDN by clicking the Generate new button.
The Host and the certificate validity period will change:
Then you can generate a CSR and import the CSR reply if you want the SCS to use a certificate signed by a Certificate Authority (CA) but this is not mandatory because now that the certificate is using the correct hostname, we can wonfigure the web browsers and the GSA to trust it.
Refer to the SCS Setup application documentation for more information about signing a certificate and importing a signed certificate.
1.5 - Starting the SCS
Click the Service tab then click the Start button:
1.6 - Accessing the SCS Web Manager
Once the SCS has started, click the Open configuration page button button.
It will open the SCS Web Manager with your default web brower.
If you get a security warning due to the certificate not being trusted, configure your browser to trust this certificate.
Then you will get prompted for authentication:
Use SCSAdmin as the username and use the password you configured during step 1.2 as the password.
The SCS Web Manager home page will appear.
2 - Linux
2.1 - Installation
On Linux systems, extract the installer executables:
tar xpzf scs-installer.tar.gz
then execute the file scs-installer.sh.
The script scs-installer.sh detects whether a desktop environment is available and starts in GUI mode or console mode.
On some Linux installations, JAVA fails to detect that the environment is headless and tries to start a GUI.
In that case, an error occurs (Could not initialize class sun.awt.X11GraphicsEnvironment) and the installer exits immediately.
To force the installer to start in console mode, run the script with the argument /NoGUI:
./scs-installer.sh /NoGUI
If your operating system has a desktop environment, an installer GUI will appear. In that case follow the Windows installation steps as the GUI is the same for windows and Linux.
If your operating system does not have a desktop environment, choose the directory where the SCS will be installed and press Enter.
When installation completes, the installer will start the SCS Setup application to proceed with the initial setup of the SCS.
The steps below describe the minimal configuration steps.
Refer to the SCS Setup application documentation for complete information about the SCS Setup application.
2.2 - HTTP setup
The SCS Setup application detects that is is starting for the first time and requests the SCS base configuration parameters:
Enter the following information:
  • As the Hostname, enter the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the machine hosting the SCS (i.e. the machine on which you just installed to SCS).
    A FQDN consists of the machine name followed by the domain suffix e.g.: mymachine.mydomain.com
  • As the HTTP port, enter a TCP port number. The port must be available as the SCS will use it to listen for incoming HTTP requests.
  • As the HTTPS port, enter a TCP port number. The port must be available as the SCS will use it to listen for incoming HTTPS requests.
  • As the Administration password, enter a password. This password will be necessary to connect to the SCS Web Manager.
Then the SCS Setup application main menu will appear:
2.3 - License installation
From the SCS Setup application main menu, select the License menu item number and press enter:
The License menu will appear:
Select the Export Instance ID menu item number and, when prompted, enter the location where the SCS instance ID file should be saved:
Send generated file by email to your Sword contact, requesting a license for this SCS instance ID.
You will receive a files named scs.lic in return.
Save this scs.lic file anywhere on the machine then select the Import License menu item number and, when prompted, enter the location where the SCS license file has been saved:
If the license is valid, a message saying License updated successfully will be displayed and you will be redirected to the main menu.
If you get back to the License menu, you will be able to see the license expiration date:
2.4 - SSL certificate
From the SCS Setup application main menu, select the Certificates menu item number and press enter:
The Certificates menu will appear:
The SCS is delivered with a self-signed certificate valid for the host localhost - which is not ideal because web browsers and the GSA will not trust this certificate and you will get a security warning every time you connect to the SCS Web Manager.
First, generate a certificate for the correct FQDN by selecting the Generate new menu item number.
A message indicating the generation of a new certificate was successful will appear the currently installed certificate information will change:
Then you can generate a CSR and import the CSR reply if you want the SCS to use a certificate signed by a Certificate Authority (CA) but this is not mandatory because now that the certificate is using the correct hostname, we can wonfigure the web browsers and the GSA to trust it.
Refer to the SCS Setup application documentation for more information about signing a certificate and importing a signed certificate.
2.5 - Starting the SCS
From the SCS Setup application main menu, select the Service menu item number and press enter:
The Service menu will appear:
Select the Start menu item number and press enter:
2.6 - Accessing the SCS Web Manager
Once the SCS has started, select the View configuration page URL menu item number and press enter.
It will output the SCS Web Manager URL.
Open this URL with a HTML5-compatible Web browser.
If you get a security warning due to the certificate not being trusted, configure your browser to trust this certificate.
Then you will get prompted for authentication:
Use SCSAdmin as the username and use the password you configured during step 1.2 as the password.
The SCS Web Manager home page will appear.
3 - Registering the GSA
3.1 - Configure GSA hostname
Click the GSA tab from the SCS Web Manager:
In the default host textbox, enter the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the GSA.
If your GSA is configured to use a dedicated admin NIC, in the Admin NIC host textbox, enter the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) associated with the admin NIC IP address.
Then press the button.
3.2 - Trust GSA certificate
Unless your GSA uses a certificate signed by a well-known Certificate Authority, the GSA certificate chain will be displayed and you will be asked to choose which certificate or CA the SCS should trust:
In above example, the GSA hostname is scsgsa2.parisgsa.lan and thte GSA certificate is signed by a local CA named PARISGSA CA.
Click on the Trust certificate button next to the certificate or CA you want the SCS to trust.
3.3 - Review and confirm
Review the GSA summary and confirm the GSA registration by clicking on the Register GSA button:
Upon successful GSA registration, you will be prompted for authentication against the SCS again.
You can either keep authenticating with your local SCSAdmin account or authenticate with a GSA admin account.
Authenticating with a GSA account allows the SCS to perform a few GSA administration tasks such as registering the connector URL pattern, ensure access to the GSA feeder gate, etc...
3.4 - Alternative to registering the GSA, the ftp server
If you wish to get the output feed on an ftp server instead of directly sending them to the GSA, you may do so by ticking the Do not directly connect to the GSA button:
Simply fill the form with the hostname, username and password for ftp access then validate.
